overview: Satis House is a multiple screen-based, videographic study. A kind of mini-puzzle film, it discovers or invents a spatio-temporal strategy for an audio-visual collection and juxtaposition of the eight sequences in David Lean’s 1946 film adaptation of Charles Dickens’ 1861 novel Great Expectations that depict protagonist Pip’s visits to the shadowy candlelit dwelling of Miss Havisham.
title: Satis House
